docs.snippet: President Roosevelt tonight called the Red Cross, of which he is honorary head, and all government agencies to help in the disastrous explosion in New London, Texas. At the same time, the President issued a statement which read:...
docs.abstract: Orders aid in New London, Tex, school explosion

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: President Roosevelt tonight called the Red Cross, of which he is honorary head, and all government agencies to help in the disastrous explosion in New London, Texas. At the same time, the President issued a statement which read:

headline.main: ROOSEVELT MOVES QUICKLY ON RELIEF; Red Cross and All Government Agencies Ordered to Lend Aid in School Disaster DOCTORS FLY TO SCENE Planes Also Take Nurses and Medical Supplies-OtherTexas Cities Speed Help Doctors Rush to the Scene ROOSEVELT ORDERS WIDE AID IN BLAST

docs.snippet: OMAHA, Sept. 4. -- The event of the week in the Corn Belt, of course, was the drought conference in Des Moines at which President Roosevelt met not only his political antagonist, Governor Landon of Kansas, but the Governors of six other Middle Wes...
docs.lead_paragraph: OMAHA, Sept. 4. -- The event of the week in the Corn Belt, of course, was the drought conference in Des Moines at which President Roosevelt met not only his political antagonist, Governor Landon of Kansas, but the Governors of six other Middle Western States and several of their United States Senators as well.

headline.main: CORN BELT IS STIRRED BY PARLEY ON DROUGHT; Importance of the Subject at Stake Transcends Interest in Meeting Of Two Presidential Rivals

headline.main: WPA DROUGHT AID ASKED; Three States Turn to Roosevelt in Red River Water Shortage.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14. -- With the approval of President Roosevelt, $4,228,377 has been allocated for flood reconstruction work in Pennsylvania, Maine, Massachusetts and West Virginia, to be expended largely in the replacement and repair of bridges ...
docs.abstract: approves allotment for reconstruction work in Pa, Maine, Mass and W Va

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14. -- With the approval of President Roosevelt, $4,228,377 has been allocated for flood reconstruction work in Pennsylvania, Maine, Massachusetts and West Virginia, to be expended largely in the replacement and repair of bridges damaged by last Spring's floods.

headline.main: ALLOTS $4,288,377 FOR FLOOD WORK; WPA Acts on Projects in Pennsylvania, Maine, Massachusetts and West Virginia. APPROVED BY PRESIDENT Most of Money Will Be Spent on Bridge -- Florida Storm Shelters Are Speeded.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP). -- A program of preliminary flood-control work in New England and the Middle Atlantic States was put into shape by Federal officials today for submission to President Roosevelt "within twenty-four hours."...
docs.abstract: heads com to select list of flood control projects for preliminary program
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP). -- A program of preliminary flood-control work in New England and the Middle Atlantic States was put into shape by Federal officials today for submission to President Roosevelt "within twenty-four hours."

headline.main: HASTEN PROJECTS FOR FLOOD CONTROL; Officials Shape for President Preliminary Program for Work in the East. TO MAKE START THIS MONTH New York, New England, Pennsylvania, Ohio, West Virginia and Maryland on List.

docs.snippet: BINGHAMTON, July 18 (AP). -- Governor Lehman was urged today by the Binghamton Citizens Flood Control Committee to expedite signing of a compact with the government for immediate beginning of preliminary work on Federal flood control construction ...
docs.abstract: Binghamton Citizens Flood Control Com urges him to speed Fed aid program
docs.lead_paragraph: BINGHAMTON, July 18 (AP). -- Governor Lehman was urged today by the Binghamton Citizens Flood Control Committee to expedite signing of a compact with the government for immediate beginning of preliminary work on Federal flood control construction in Central-Southern New York.

headline.main: PRESS FLOOD AID IN STATE; Binghamton Citizens Appeal to Lehman and Ickes for Speed.

docs.snippet: ALL this hubbub about making the world safe for democracy ignores one fact. Nature, the worst of aristocrats, is still upon her throne. Man is her subject and victim. We talk of wrestling her secrets from her, utilizing her powers to our advantage...
docs.abstract: Feature article by C F Talman, Nature the despot, is still untamed, illus
docs.lead_paragraph: ALL this hubbub about making the world safe for democracy ignores one fact. Nature, the worst of aristocrats, is still upon her throne. Man is her subject and victim. We talk of wrestling her secrets from her, utilizing her powers to our advantage, making ourselves, in short, independent of her capricious despotism.

headline.main: NATURE, THE DESPOT, IS STILL UNTAMED; Aroused to Anger and Capricious Havoc, She Holds the Supreme Power of Life and Death Over Puny Man

docs.snippet: MANISTEE, Mich., Oct. 15. -- The identity of the four-masted schooner reported ashore near here has been established. The vessel is the Minnehaha of Cleveland, Capt. William Packer, with a cargo of corn, Of the seven on board the schooner, but one...
docs.lead_paragraph: MANISTEE, Mich., Oct. 15. -- The identity of the four-masted schooner reported ashore near here has been established. The vessel is the Minnehaha of Cleveland, Capt. William Packer, with a cargo of corn, Of the seven on board the schooner, but one, Capt. Packer, escaped. Those drowned were:

headline.main: WRECK OF THE MINNEHAHA.; Six of Her Crew Lost in Lake Michigan, Near Manistee.
